DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for melanoma of the skin based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma._Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients._One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/9/18 tt moved to NCI Standards Context. Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical N Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  The TNM clinical and pathologic regional lymph nodes tumor classifications of cutaneous melanoma are not the same. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma cN3 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma cN3 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with 1 or more metastatic nodes with in transit met(s)/satellite(s). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma cN3 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with 1 or more metastatic nodes with in transit met(s)/satellite(s). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma cN2c TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma cN2c TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with intralymphatic metastases (in transit or satellite metastases) without metastatic nodes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma cN2c TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with intralymphatic metastases (in transit or satellite metastases) without metastatic nodes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma cN1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma cN1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastasis in one regional lymph node.  Macrometastases are defined as clinically detectable nodal metastases confirmed by therapeutic lymphadenectomy or when nodal metastasis exhibits gross extracapsular extension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma cN1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastasis in one regional lymph node.  Macrometastases are defined as clinically detectable nodal metastases confirmed by therapeutic lymphadenectomy or when nodal metastasis exhibits gross extracapsular extension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma cN0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma cN0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma in which no regional metastases are detected. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma cN0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma in which no regional metastases are detected. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma cNX TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma cNX TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., previously removed for another reason).  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma cNX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., previously removed for another reason).  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

The TNM clinical and pathologic regional lymph nodes tumor classifications of cutaneous melanoma are not the same. Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  The TNM clinical and pathologic regional lymph nodes tumor classifications of cutaneous melanoma are not the same. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

The extent of a cancer in the body.
